title: Supreme Court Law Clerk Recruitment 2026 ‚Äì New Delhi
overview:
Supreme Court of India (SCI), New Delhi has released an official recruitment notification inviting applications for the post of Law Clerk-cum-Research Associate. A total of 90 vacancies are available under this recruitment drive.

The online application process started on 20 January 2026 and will remain open until 07 February 2026. Eligible candidates must fall within the prescribed age limits as mentioned below. Applicants are advised to carefully review the official notification before submitting their application.

üìÖ Application Schedule & Examination Plan

Online Application Start Date: 20 January 2026

Last Date to Apply Online: 07 February 2026

Final Date for Fee Payment: 07 February 2026

Written Examination Date: 07 March 2026

Admit Card Release: Before the examination

Result Declaration: To be announced

‚ö†Ô∏è Candidates should regularly check the official Supreme Court website for updates or changes in schedule.

üí∞ Application Fee Structure

All Category Candidates: ‚Çπ750

Accepted Online Payment Modes

Debit Card, Credit Card, Net Banking, IMPS, Mobile Wallets

üéØ Age Criteria (as on 07 February 2026)

Minimum Age: 20 Years

Maximum Age: 32 Years

üìå Age relaxation will be applicable as per Supreme Court recruitment rules.

üìä Vacancy Overview

Total Vacancies: 90 Posts

Post Name	Number of Vacancies
Law Clerk-cum-Research Associate	90
üéì Educational Qualification

Candidates must fulfill one of the following conditions:

Must be appearing in the final year of a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Law (LLB)

OR must have completed LLB from a recognized university or institution

üìù How to Submit Supreme Court Law Clerk Online Form 2026

Visit the official Supreme Court recruitment portal

Complete registration/login using valid credentials

Fill in the application form with accurate personal and academic details

Upload required documents in the prescribed format

Pay the application fee online

Submit the application on or before 07 February 2026

‚ö†Ô∏è Important Advisory:
Candidates are strongly advised to read the official notification carefully, especially details related to age limit, eligibility criteria, and important dates, before submitting the form.

üèÜ Selection Procedure

The selection process will consist of the following stages:

Part-I Written Examination (Objective Type)

Part-II Written Examination (Subjective Type)

Personal Interview

Document Verification

Medical Examination

üîó Useful Important Links

Apply Online (Registration / Login):
https://cdn3.digialm.com/EForms/configuredHtml/32912/97660/Registration.html

Download Official Notification (PDF):
https://cdn.s3waas.gov.in/s3ec0490f1f4972d133619a60c30f3559e/uploads/2026/01/2026012040.pdf

Supreme Court Official Recruitment Portal:
https://www.sci.gov.in/recruitments/

‚ùì Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

Q1. When did the Supreme Court Law Clerk application process start?
‚úî The application process started on 20 January 2026.

Q2. What is the last date to apply online?
‚úî 07 February 2026.

Q3. What is the age limit for Supreme Court Law Clerk Recruitment 2026?
‚úî Minimum 20 years and maximum 32 years as on 07 February 2026.

Q4. What educational qualification is required?
‚úî Final-year LLB students or candidates who have completed Bachelor of Law (LLB).

Q5. Where can I find official updates?
‚úî On the Supreme Court of India recruitment website.

title: RRB Group D Recruitment 2026 ‚Äì Apply Online for 22,000+ Level-1 Posts
overview:
The Railway Recruitment Boards (RRB) have issued an initial notification regarding the upcoming Group D (Level-1) Recruitment 2026 across multiple railway zones in India. Through this recruitment process, more than 22,000 tentative vacancies are expected to be filled.

The online application process is scheduled to begin from 31 January 2026, and eligible candidates will be able to submit their applications until 02 March 2026. Applicants must ensure that they meet the prescribed age limit, educational qualification, and eligibility conditions before applying.

This recruitment is a strong opportunity for 10th pass and ITI-qualified candidates seeking a secure government job in Indian Railways with steady income, allowances, and long-term career growth.

Railway RRB Group D Online Form 2026 ‚Äì Overview

Examination Name: RRB Group D (Level-1) Examination 2026

Conducting Authority: Railway Recruitment Boards (RRB)

Total Vacancies: 22,000+ (Tentative)

Job Level: Level-1 (7th Pay Commission)

Mode of Application: Online

Important Dates (Tentative)

Online Application Start Date: 31 January 2026

Last Date to Apply Online: 02 March 2026

Last Date for Fee Payment: 02 March 2026

Examination Date: To be announced

Exam City Intimation: Before examination

Admit Card Release: Prior to exam

Result Declaration: Will be updated later

üëâ Candidates should regularly check the official RRB website for confirmed dates.

Examination Fee

Maximum Age: 33 Years

Assistant Loco Shed (Electrical)	To be notified

Assistant TL & AC (Workshop)	To be notified

Eligibility Criteria

Candidates are eligible to apply if they fulfill any one of the following conditions:

Passed Class 10 (Matriculation) from a recognized board

How to Apply for RRB Group D Recruitment 2026

Interested candidates must apply online only before 02 March 2026

Other Allowances	As per rules

Apply Online: Link active from 31 January 2026

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

Q1. When will the online application for RRB Group D Recruitment 2026 start?
The online application process is expected to begin on 31 January 2026.

Q2. What is the last date to apply online?
The last date for submitting the application form is 02 March 2026.

Q3. What is the age limit for RRB Group D 2026?
Candidates must be between 18 and 33 years, with relaxation as per RRB rules.

Q4. What is the minimum qualification required?
Applicants must have passed Class 10 or hold a National Apprenticeship Certificate (NAC).

Q5. What is the official website of Indian Railways?
The official website is https://indianrailways.gov.in/

title: UPSSSC Lekhpal Recruitment 2026 ‚Äì Online Form for 7,994 Posts

title: Railway Group-D Hiring 2026: What Candidates Need to Know
overview:
The Railway Recruitment Boards (RRBs) have shared an initial update regarding Group-D (Level-1) hiring for 2026. This drive is expected to cover more than 22,000 positions across multiple railway zones in India.

Online registration is expected to open from 31 January 2026 and remain active until 02 March 2026. This opportunity is aimed mainly at 10th-pass and ITI-qualified candidates looking for long-term employment in Indian Railways under the 7th Pay Commission.



Why This Railway Recruitment Matters

Group-D roles form the backbone of Indian Railways operations. Selected candidates receive:

Permanent government employment

Regular salary increments

DA, HRA, and other allowances

Promotion opportunities through departmental exams

This makes the 2026 cycle especially attractive for first-time government job aspirants.

Expected Application Timeline

The following schedule is based on the short notice released so far:

Registration Opens: 31 January 2026 (tentative)

Last Date to Apply: 02 March 2026 (tentative)

Fee Submission Deadline: 02 March 2026

Exam Schedule: To be announced

Admit Card & City Intimation: Prior to examination

Applicants should track updates only through official RRB sources.

Who Can Apply?
Age Requirement

Minimum age: 18 years

Upper age limit: 33 years

Relaxation in the upper age limit will apply as per Railway norms for reserved categories.

Educational Background

Applicants must meet one of the following:

Passed Class 10 (Matriculation) from a recognized board

OR hold an ITI / National Apprenticeship Certificate (NAC) issued by NCVT or SCVT

Roles Covered Under Group-D Level-1

The recruitment will include operational and maintenance roles such as:

Track Maintainer Grade-IV

Pointsman

Electrical, Mechanical, Signal & Telecom Assistants

Workshop and Loco Shed Assistants

Bridge and Track Machine Assistants

Zone-wise vacancy breakup will be released with the detailed notification.

Examination & Selection Flow

The selection process is designed to assess both knowledge and physical fitness:

Computer-Based Test (CBT)

Physical Efficiency Test (PET)

Document Verification

Medical Fitness Test

Final appointment will be made only after clearing all stages.

Application Charges & Refund Policy
Fee at the Time of Registration

General / OBC candidates: ‚Çπ500

SC / ST / EBC / Female / Transgender candidates: ‚Çπ250

Refund After Appearing in CBT

General / OBC: ‚Çπ400 refunded

Reserved categories: Full ‚Çπ250 refunded

Payments must be made online via cards, net banking, IMPS, or wallets.

Salary Snapshot After Selection

Group-D posts fall under Level-1 of the 7th CPC:

Basic Pay: ‚Çπ18,000 per month

In-hand salary: approx. ‚Çπ22,000‚Äì‚Çπ25,000 per month

Additional benefits: DA, HRA/TA, medical facilities, night duty allowance (where applicable)

How the Application Process Will Work

Once registration begins:

Visit the official RRB portal

Complete new user registration

Fill personal and academic details

Upload documents and photograph

Pay the applicable fee

Submit before 02 March 2026

Late submissions will not be accepted.

Important Advice for Applicants

Candidates are strongly advised to:

Read the detailed notification once released

Verify eligibility before applying

Avoid last-day registration to prevent technical issues

Official Online Resources

Application Portal: Active from 31 January 2026

Short Notice PDF: Available

Detailed Notification: To be released

Railways Official Website: https://indianrailways.gov.in/

Common Questions Answered

When does Railway Group-D registration start?
From 31 January 2026 (tentative).

What is the last date to apply?
02 March 2026.

Is ITI mandatory?
No. Class 10 pass candidates are also eligible.

What is the age limit?
18 to 33 years, with applicable relaxations.

title: UP Police Constable Hiring 2026: Full Notification Overview
overview:
The Uttar Pradesh Police Recruitment and Promotion Board has officially announced a large-scale recruitment drive for Constable-level posts in Uttar Pradesh Police. Through this process, 32,679 vacancies will be filled across civil police, PAC, armed units, jail warder, and special forces.

The online registration process began on 31 December 2025 and will remain open until 30 January 2026. Interested candidates must ensure they meet the prescribed age, education, and physical criteria before submitting the application.

Key Highlights at a Glance

Recruitment Authority: UPPRPB

Post Name: Police Constable (Multiple Units)

Total Vacancies: 32,679

Application Mode: Online

Last Date to Apply: 30 January 2026

Job Location: Uttar Pradesh

Application Schedule & Exam Timeline

Based on the official notification, the recruitment process will follow this schedule:

Registration Start Date: 31 December 2025

Last Date for Online Application: 30 January 2026

Fee Payment Deadline: 30 January 2026

Fee Adjustment Date: 02 February 2026

Written Exam Date: To be announced

Admit Card Availability: Before examination

Result Declaration: To be updated

Applicants should rely only on the official UP Police portal for updates.

Application Fee Structure

The application fee differs by category:

General / EWS / OBC: ‚Çπ500

SC / ST: ‚Çπ400

Accepted Online Payment Options

Debit Card

Credit Card

Net Banking

IMPS

Mobile Wallets

Age Criteria (As on 01 July 2025)

The minimum age for all categories is 18 years. Maximum age limits vary by category and gender:

UR / EWS (Male): 25 years

UR / EWS (Female): 28 years

OBC / SC / ST (Male): 30 years

OBC / SC / ST (Female): 33 years

Age relaxation will be applied as per UP Police recruitment rules.

Vacancy Distribution Snapshot
Category-wise Reservation

General: 13,093

EWS: 3,264

OBC: 8,818

SC: 6,857

ST: 647

Post-wise Allocation

Constable PAC / Armed Police: 15,131

Constable (Civil Police ‚Äì Male/Female): 10,469

Constable / PAC (Female): 2,282

Constable (Special Security Force): 1,341

Jail Warder (Male): 3,279

Jail Warder (Female): 106

Mounted Constable: 71

Educational Requirement

Applicants must have completed 10+2 (Intermediate) or an equivalent qualification from a recognized board in India.

Physical Standards Required
For Male Candidates

UR / OBC / SC:

Height: 168 cm

Chest: 79‚Äì84 cm

ST:

Height: 160 cm

Chest: 77‚Äì82 cm

For Female Candidates

UR / OBC / SC:

Height: 152 cm

Weight: Minimum 40 kg

ST:

Height: 147 cm

Weight: Minimum 40 kg

Physical Efficiency Test (PET)

Candidates qualifying the written exam must clear PET:

Male Candidates: 4.8 km run in 25 minutes

Female Candidates: 2.4 km run in 14 minutes

Selection Stages Explained

The recruitment process will be conducted in the following order:

Written Examination

Physical Standard Test (PST)

Physical Efficiency Test (PET)

Document Verification

Medical Examination

Final selection will depend on performance across all stages.

How to Submit the Application

Candidates should follow these steps before the deadline:

Visit the official UP Police recruitment website

Complete new registration using valid details

Fill out the application form carefully

Upload required documents and photographs

Pay the applicable examination fee

Submit the form before 30 January 2026

Late or incomplete applications will not be accepted.

Candidate Advisory

Applicants are strongly advised to read the official notification carefully before applying, particularly sections related to age limits, physical standards, and eligibility conditions.

Official Reference Links

Online Application Portal

Age Relaxation Notice

Detailed Notification PDF

Syllabus & Exam Pattern

Official UP Police Website: https://uppbpb.gov.in/Home/Index

Frequently Asked Questions

When did UP Police Constable applications start?
The application process began on 31 December 2025.

What is the closing date for registration?
The last date to apply online is 30 January 2026.

What qualification is required?
Candidates must have passed Intermediate (10+2) or an equivalent exam.

What is the maximum age limit?
Depending on category and gender, the upper age limit ranges from 25 to 33 years.
